topic.title: HP Helion 1.3 Development Platform: Quick Start Developer Trial

titlealts.searchtitle: Quick Start Developer Trial Step 3: Create Sandbox

body.p: During this step, you will log in to the Helion Public Cloud and use the web-based console to create the sandbox environment.

strow.stentry:
1. Register for your Helion Public Cloud Account
2. Download Tools
3. Create the Sandbox Environment
4. Create a Cluster
5. Add Windows DEA and SQL Server (Optional Step)
6. Explore Sample Applications

ol.li: Log into the Horizon console using the HP Helion Public Cloud username and password that you created during registration.
Follow the steps to create a public-facing network. These networking prerequisites are not available by default.

In the US West section, in the Compute row, click Activate to activate the Compute service. Activating the Compute service is required for creating VM instances. Due to load balancing, your account may be provisioned to use USEast instead of USWest. If you see the Launch Instance button in the Instances pane disabled, try the other region.
Click the Project panel and then the Compute sub-panel.

Download the configuration file (RC file). RC files contain information about a hosted service, including region, tenant, and other information required to create a cluster. This RC file has been pre-configured for this sandbox project.
In the Compute menu, click Access & Security and then click the API Access tab.
Click Download OpenStack RC file.

Create a key pair.
Click on the Compute sub-panel and then click Access & Security.
Click on the Key Pairs tab and then click + Create Key Pair.
Enter a name in the Key Pair Name field and then click Create Key Pair.
The key pair should download automatically. If not, click the link and save the file (filename.pem) somewhere convenient. This file contains the RSA private key that you will need to SSH into your VM instance.
